## How to start

Follow these instructions to use the template on Figma:

<OrderedList>
  <OrderedListItem>Read the template's documentation.</OrderedListItem>
  <OrderedListItem>
    Create a copy of the{' '}
    <a href="https://www.figma.com/file/M4O0WAcWAZ7eUDPPWH6mu3/Form-Page-Template?node-id=504%3A208847&t=LucYA5v4whGFbT5q-1">
      Figma file
    </a>
    , so you can get started with your own version.
  </OrderedListItem>
  <OrderedListItem>
    Make the desired changes to content and components. Make sure you access our
    components' documentation to learn more about each one.
  </OrderedListItem>
  <OrderedListItem>
    Share your version of the prototype with the developers in your team.
  </OrderedListItem>
</OrderedList>

<br />
<br />

:::info
The template is flexible, which means you can make customizations according to your specific scenario. Use the Admin UI components to make adjustments and, if you have any questions, [contact us](https://admin-ui.vercel.app/documentation/introduction/contact-us).
:::

<br />

## Variants

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>When to use sections in a form?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    <ul>
      <li>
        Use sections for forms with more than five fields, when the fields can
        grouped in a way that makes sense to merchants and won't disrupt their
        experience. For example, it makes sense to group the fields for an
        address in a section.
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
  <br />
  <div>
    <strong>What to avoid:</strong>
    <ul>
      <li>
        Don't include fields and lists with referenced objects in the same
        section.
      </li>
      <li>
        Don't include conditional fields and non-conditional fields in the same
        section.
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</details>

<br />

## Position

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>What should be the order of the form sections?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    Order them using the following criteria:
    <ul>
      <li>More general to more specific.</li>
      <li>Required to optional.</li>
      <li>Most important to least important.</li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</details>

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>What should be the order of input fields and controls in a section?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    Order them using the following criteria:
    <ul>
      <li>More general to more specific.</li>
      <li>Required to optional.</li>
      <li>Most important to least important.</li>
    </ul>
    Read each field or control component’s documentation for further
    information.
  </div>
</details>

<br />

## Behavior

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>What is the input fields' behavior?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    If you want to know what is the behavior of input fields in a Form, read the{' '}
    <strong>Behavior</strong> section in the component’s documentation.
  </div>
</details>

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>What is the controls’ behavior?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    If you want to know what is the behavior of controls in a Form, read the{' '}
    <strong>Behavior</strong> section in the component’s documentation.
  </div>
</details>

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>When to use conditional fields?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    <ul>
      <li>
        Conditional fields are fields that become visible or are hidden
        depending on the value of a control field.
      </li>
      <li>
        Use a <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/switch">Switch</a>{' '}
        to control the visibility of sections and fields during a progressive
        fill.
      </li>
      <li>
        Use a <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/radio">Radio</a>{' '}
        to choose among options that will affect the following fields to be
        filled. For example, the form for creating a promotion can have
        conditional fields based on the type of promotion that was chosen.
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</details>

<br />

## Content

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>
      What should be the page title, URL route and Admin navigation entry?
    </h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    <ul>
      <li>
        When an existing object is being edited, include the name of the object
        in the page title, URL route and Admin navigation entry, such as{' '}
        <em>Christmas Discount</em>.
      </li>
      <li>
        When a new object is being created, use the word *New* and the name of
        the entity, such as <em>New Product</em>.
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</details>

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>What actions should be in the header of a form page?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    <ul>
      <li>
        Include a tertiary{' '}
        <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/button">Button</a> that
        leads back to the first-level page with the icon <em>ArrowLeft</em> and
        the hidden label <em>Back</em>.
      </li>
      <li>
        Include a primary{' '}
        <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/button">Button</a> to
        save the data with the label <em>Save</em>.
      </li>
      <li>
        Include a secondary{' '}
        <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/button">Button</a> to
        discard unsaved changes and leave the flow with the label{' '}
        <em>Cancel</em>.
      </li>
      <li>
        For objects that have already been created, include a{' '}
        <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/menu">Menu</a> with
        actions such as <em>Export</em> and <em>Delete</em> when editing.
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</details>

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>What should be the title of a form section?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    <ul>
      <li>
        When the form has more than one section, it is recommended to use a
        title in all sections to describe the content of each one.
      </li>
      <li>
        A form section title should explain the type of information the merchant
        will input or select in the following group of fields and controls. For
        example, use the <em>Address</em> label to group address-related fields.
      </li>
      <li>Use sentence case, but capitalize proper nouns.</li>
    </ul>
  </div>
  <br />
  <div>
    <strong>What to avoid:</strong>
    <ul>
      <li>
        When the form has only one section, do not use the title in the section,
        use the page title to describe it.
      </li>
      <li>
        Don't include redundant words. Example: in a Form called{' '}
        <em>New Store</em>, do not name the form section <em>Store Address</em>,
        use only <em>Address</em>.
      </li>
      <li>
        Don't use verbs. For example, instead of <em>Select address</em>, use
        only <em>Address</em>.
      </li>
      <li>Don't use punctuation.</li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</details>

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>What should be the description of a form section?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    <ul>
      <li>
        In most cases, the form section title should be self explanatory. Add a
        description if the form section is critical or complex.
      </li>
      <li>
        Write the description text as if you are answering the following
        question: <em>What does this mean?</em> For example, for an{' '}
        <em>Address</em> section, the description text can be{' '}
        <em>Location of the store</em>.
      </li>
      <li>
        Start with a noun followed by additional information, such as conditions
        and definitions.
      </li>
      <li>Use sentence case, but capitalize proper nouns.</li>
      <li>Prefer using a single sentence that is short and direct.</li>
    </ul>
  </div>
  <br />
  <div>
    <strong>What to avoid:</strong>
    <ul>
      <li>Don’t write text longer than 110 characters.</li>
      <li>Don’t repeat the form title.</li>
      <li>Don’t explain the benefits of the content, only its meaning.</li>
      <li>Don’t use periods.</li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</details>

<details>
  <summary>
    <h4>What should be the content of a form section?</h4>
  </summary>
  <div>
    <ul>
      <li>
        The content of a form section is basically input fields and controls.
        Access each component’s documentation for further information:
        <ul>
          <li>
            <strong>Input fields</strong>:{' '}
            <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/text-input">
              TextInput
            </a>
            ,{' '}
            <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/text-area">
              TextArea
            </a>
            ,{' '}
            <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/number-input">
              NumberInput
            </a>
            ,{' '}
            <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/experimental/date-picker">
              DatePicker
            </a>{' '}
            and{' '}
            <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/experimental/combobox">
              Combobox
            </a>
            .
          </li>
          <li>
            <strong>Controls</strong>:{' '}
            <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/checkbox">
              Checkbox
            </a>
            , <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/radio">Radio</a>,{' '}
            <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/select">Select</a>{' '}
            and{' '}
            <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/switch">Switch</a>.
          </li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
        Use a list section when the merchant can add sub-items or references to
        the main form. In that case, use{' '}
        <a href="https://admin-ui.vercel.app/components/modal">Modals</a> to add
        or select items for the list. Such as, when the merchant adds a user in
        a list of users when create a user role.
      </li>
    </ul>
  </div>
</details>
